static void liquibase.util.JdbcUtils.closeStatement ( Statement  stmt  )  [static]

Close the given JDBC Statement and ignore any thrown exception.

This is useful for typical finally blocks in manual JDBC code.

Parameters:
stmt the JDBC Statement to close (may be null)

static Object liquibase.util.JdbcUtils.getResultSetValue ( ResultSet  rs,
int  index 
) throws SQLException [static]

Retrieve a JDBC column value from a ResultSet, using the most appropriate value type.

The returned value should be a detached value object, not having any ties to the active ResultSet: in particular, it should not be a Blob or Clob object but rather a byte array respectively String representation.

Uses the getObject(index) method, but includes additional "hacks" to get around Oracle 10g returning a non-standard object for its TIMESTAMP datatype and a java.sql.Date for DATE columns leaving out the time portion: These columns will explicitly be extracted as standard java.sql.Timestamp object.

Parameters:
rs is the ResultSet holding the data
index is the column index
Returns:
the value object
Exceptions:
SQLException if thrown by the JDBC API
See also:
java.sql.Blob

java.sql.Clob

java.sql.Timestamp

Definition at line 78 of file JdbcUtils.java.

00078                                                                                         {
00079         Object obj = rs.getObject(index);
00080         if (obj instanceof Blob) {
00081             obj = rs.getBytes(index);
00082         } else if (obj instanceof Clob) {
00083             obj = rs.getString(index);
00084         } else if (obj != null && obj.getClass().getName().startsWith("oracle.sql.TIMESTAMP")) {
00085             obj = rs.getTimestamp(index);
00086         } else if (obj != null && obj.getClass().getName().startsWith("oracle.sql.DATE")) {
00087             String metaDataClassName = rs.getMetaData().getColumnClassName(index);
00088             if ("java.sql.Timestamp".equals(metaDataClassName) ||
00089                     "oracle.sql.TIMESTAMP".equals(metaDataClassName)) {
00090                 obj = rs.getTimestamp(index);
00091             } else {
00092                 obj = rs.getDate(index);
00093             }
00094         } else if (obj != null && obj instanceof java.sql.Date) {
00095             if ("java.sql.Timestamp".equals(rs.getMetaData().getColumnClassName(index))) {
00096                 obj = rs.getTimestamp(index);
00097             }
00098         }
00099         return obj;
00100     }

static Object liquibase.util.JdbcUtils.requiredSingleResult ( Collection  results  )  throws JDBCException [static]

Return a single result object from the given Collection.

Throws an exception if 0 or more than 1 element found.

Parameters:
results the result Collection (can be null)
Returns:
the single result object

Definition at line 121 of file JdbcUtils.java.

00122         int size = (results != null ? results.size() : 0);
00123         if (size == 0) {
00124             throw new JDBCException("Empty result set, expected one row");
00125         }
